messages.title: Labour’s better plan for our economy
messages.content: A lot of things have changed in Enfield since the last election five years ago - and I'm afraid that not many of them are for the better. Chase Farm Hospital has lost its A&E and maternity services, for example. That's despite the Tories explicitly promising to keep them open before the last election. But I think it's day-to-day life that people in Enfield are really feeling the effects of this Tory Government.

You see, the Tories talk a lot about the economic recovery and how they’ve fixed the economy, And, of course, I will always welcome every new job that someone in Enfield is offered. But there’s something they’re not telling us.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A plan to raise the minimum wage, ban exploitative zero hours contracts, and get the next generation back to work with a job guarantee for the long-term unemployed young.

issues.economy: A plan to raise the minimum wage, ban exploitative zero hours contracts, and get the next generation back to work with a job guarantee for the long-term unemployed young.
issues.health: Despite promising to keep them open, Tory MP Nick de Bois and his Government closed Chase Farm A&E and maternity services.

contactInformation.address: Celtic Hall, 7 Lancaster Road, Enfield EN2 0DW

images.caption: Joan Ryan - Building a better future for us all
